page.title: 09HOMES IN CRANTOCK & PENTIRE
page.content: There are a lot of old houses in{ {Crantock}which have very old style window frames. The houses are often close together, and people have lived here for over 1200 years. There are few modern houses, no very big hotels, but there are some small hotels. Just outside the village there is an inn called "The Bowgie", which in Cornish means "Cow Shed". {Pentire}housing is mainly modern and expensive. A large new housing estate is still being built. Most buildings are hotels, guest houses or have been turned into flats. Some people live in bungalows which are often luxurious. Many of the houses enjoy wonderful views over the Gannel Estuary and Crantock Bay. There are very few shops near the houses on Pentire, so people shop in Newquay.
